articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Iranian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Iranian President
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, Presidium member of the Political Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of sympathy to Hassan Rouhani, president of the Islamic Republic of Iran, on Monday which said:
					 Upon hearing the sad news that Kermanshah region located in the west of Iran was hit earthquake, claiming heavy human and material losses, I express my deep sympathy and condolences to you and, through you, to the victims and their families.
					
					 I hope that you and your government will recover from the consequences of this disaster at the earliest possible date and bring the life of the citizens in the disaster-stricken region to normal.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Palestine
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Palestine
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Mahmoud Abbas, president of Palestine, on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of the proclamation of the State of Palestine.
					 The message wished the Palestinian people bigger success in their just struggle to put an end to the occupation by Israel and build an independent state with East Kuds as its capital city.

articles.title: DPRK RC Society Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK RC Society Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society led by Paek Yong Ho, executive vice-chairman of its Central Committee, came back home Tuesday after taking part in the 21st General Assembly and the meeting of the Board of Directors of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies held in Turkey.

articles.title: German Guest Leaves
articles.content:
German Guest Leaves
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Wolfgang Nowak, former general director for Political Planning of Mr. Schroeder's Cabinet of Germany, left here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Swedish Delegation Here
articles.content:
Swedish Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Swedish Institute for Security and Development Policy led by Director Niklas Swanstrom arrived here Tuesday.

articles.title: Cuban Diplomats Visit Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
articles.content:
Cuban Diplomats Visit Mangyongdae Revolutionary School
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the embassy Tuesday visited Mangyongdae Revolutionary School on the occasion of the 61st anniversary of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba.
					 The guests went round the revolutionary museum, lecture rooms, swimming pool, gymnasium, etc. of the school, being briefed on the fact that the children of revolutionary martyrs are growing up to be reliable backbones of the Juche revolution thanks to respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un's noble revolutionary obligation and love for posterity.

articles.title: Syrian Embassy Officials Visit Party Founding Museum
articles.content:
Syrian Embassy Officials Visit Party Founding Museum
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Syrian Ambassador to the DPRK Tammam Sulaiman and his embassy officials visited the Party Founding Museum Tuesday on the anniversary of the Corrective Movement in Syria.
					 The visitors went round historic data and relics, being briefed on the exploits of President Kim Il Sung who set a shining example in building the revolutionary party.

articles.title: Social Scientists Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Social Scientists Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 3rd national meeting of social scientists visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun Tuesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They expressed reverence to the great leaders, looking up to their statues.
					
					 At the halls where the great leaders lie in state, the visitors made bows to the peerlessly great men.
					
					 They looked round rooms in which orders presented to the leaders are on display and halls housing cars, a motor car, a boat and a train coach used by the great leaders during the field guidance and foreign visits till the last moments of their revolutionary life.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il by Korean Social Scientists from Japan
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il by Korean Social Scientists from Japan
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Tuesday.
					 They presented bunches of flowers before the statues and paid tribute to the great leaders.

articles.title: 4th Enlarged Plenary Meeting of 6th SWUK Central Committee
articles.content:
4th Enlarged Plenary Meeting of 6th SWUK Central Committee
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The 4th enlarged plenary meeting of the 6th Central Committee of the Socialist Women's Union of Korea was held in Pyongyang Tuesday.
					 Present there were members and alternate members of the Central Committee of the Union and the union officials.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue of implementing the tasks set forth by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un at the 2nd plenary meeting of the 7th Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Jang Chun Sil, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the union, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The speakers noted that at the 2nd plenary meeting of the 7th WPK Central Committee Kim Jong Un clarified the orientation and tasks for bringing about a fresh surge in the struggle to build a socialist power with the might of single-minded unity under the uplifted banner of independence and the self-development-first spirit.
					
					 All the officials and members of the union should fulfill the duties they have assumed as Korean women in the present all-out general charge for implementing the decisions made at the 7th WPK Congress with confidence in sure victory and in the spirit of devotedly carrying out the decisions, they said.
					
					 They underscored the need for all the women's union organizations to conduct dynamic political work and various mass movements for effecting a fresh turn in building a socialist economic power with self-development as a great driving force and with the might of science and technology.

articles.title: Sci-tech Presentation and Exhibition on Crop Rearing Held
articles.content:
Sci-tech Presentation and Exhibition on Crop Rearing Held
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The national scientific and technical presentation and exhibition in the field of crop rearing opened at the Sci-Tech Complex Tuesday under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Submitted to the presentation, divided into rearing panel and cultivation panel, are more than 100 dissertations.
					
					 Presented to the exhibition are high-yielding crops including paddy rice, non-paddy rice, corn, bean, wheat and barley which can increase to maximum per hectare yield and the level of intensive farming under the climatic conditions of Korea.
					
					 The presentation and exhibition will last until Nov. 17 and there will be a lecture on "Present situation of the rice enriching system and future prospect".

articles.title: Food Exhibition Held
articles.content:
Food Exhibition Held
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The 7th National Exhibition of Liquor and Essential Foodstuff opened at the exhibition hall of mass consumption goods of the Ministry of Food and Consumer Goods Industries of the DPRK on Tuesday
					 Presented to it are more than 1 800 kinds of liquors and essential foodstuff made at foodstuff production units across the country.
					
					 During the exhibition, there will be visits to the Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory, etc. and lectures on the issues arising in developing the country's foodstuff industry.
					
					 Attending its opening ceremony were Jo Yong Chol, minister of Food and Consumer Goods Industries, and officials, technicians and employees of the exhibiting units.
					
					 The exhibition will last until Nov. 17.

articles.title: Centenarian Receives Birthday Spread
articles.content:
Centenarian Receives Birthday Spread
 Unjon, November 14 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un sent a birthday spread to Kim Yong Hwa, a woman centenarian living in Samkwang-ri, Unjon County of North Phyongan Province.
					 She was born into a poor peasant family. She bitterly experienced the grief of being a member of the stateless nation before the liberation of the country.
					
					 After the liberation she was provided with her own fertile land thanks to President Kim Il Sung and could live a worthy life as a master of the land and the country. She took part in the plow woman movement and tangibly contributed to increasing the cereal production as the widow of a fallen solider during the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 She devotedly worked to do her bit as the one who is responsible for the granary of the country. She also donated tens of tons of grains for the sake of the country.

articles.title: Winter Fishing Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Winter Fishing Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Winter fishing is gaining momentum in the East Sea of Korea.
					 Hundreds of ships from the fishery stations in the east coastal area are making all efforts for fishing in waters off North Hamgyong and Kangwon provinces and Riwon-Sinchang and other main fishing grounds.
					
					 Water temperature transmission system based on satellite information, system for detecting fishing ground and a program for estimating hard-finned sandfish fishery have been introduced into fishery stations and fishing boats under the Ministry of Fisheries.
					
					 Now, fishery stations are catching hundreds of tons of fish on a daily average by increasing the operational rate of fishing boats to the maximum, raising the frequency of hauling in a net and making a big haul per ship.
					
					 Taking the lead in the winter fishing are the Sinpho Distant-Sea Fishery Complex and the Wonsan and Kimchaek fishery stations.
					
					 Factory ships process fish promptly, and fish are being handled at landing places in Soho, Wonsan, Thongchon and other areas in an intensive way.

articles.title: Universal, Free Medical Care in the DPRK
articles.content:
Universal, Free Medical Care in the DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The most advantageous healthcare system has been established in the DPRK.
					 The state has enforced universal, free medical care to take care of people in a responsible manner.
					
					 Universal, free medical care is being enforced in the urban and rural areas, and factory and office workers, and farmers and all other people is enjoying benefits from it.
					
					 Hospitalization, outpatient treatment, doctor's visit, medical checkup, experimental check, functional diagnosis, operation, preventive inoculation and all other services for preventing and curing diseases, and medical service at sanitaria are free.
					
					 In January, Juche 38 (1949), President Kim Il Sung said that universal, free medical care should be certainly enforced for the people's long life in good health at the state expense, and saw to it that the relevant decision of the DPRK Cabinet was adopted in November 1952 during the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 In order to successfully enforcing universal, free medical care, the state made sure that hospitals, clinics and other medical service facilities increased and many health workers were trained. It is providing medicines and medical appliances and developing medical science and technology to improve the quality of service.
					
					 Hospitals and clinics have been set up in provinces, cities, counties, ris and major industrial establishments and bases for producing pharmaceutical and medical instruments and Koryo medicines built to contribute to promoting the people's health.

articles.title: Socialism of Juche Is Invincible: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Socialism of Juche Is Invincible: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday dedicates an article to the 25th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is the Lifeline of Our People".
					 The work, published on November 14, Juche 81 (1992), deals with the necessity to defend the world socialist movement and the cause of socialism and indicates the tasks and ways for defending and advancing the socialist cause.
					
					 Korean-style socialism deeply rooted in the minds of the people is the true one that comprehensively embodies the people-first principle and makes selfless, devoted efforts for the good of the people, the article says, adding:
					
					 Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses puts forward the people as the most valuable beings, regards their interests as the most sacred and makes everything serve for them.
					
					 The leader and soldiers, the former and the people are firmly united with comradely love and sense of obligation and the whole society forms a harmonious family linked with the bond of kinship and shares destiny. This is the true picture and advantages of Korean-style socialism.
					
					 Korean-style socialism deeply rooted in the minds of the people is invincible as it defends and brings into full bloom the people's joy by its tremendous strength.
					
					 The Korean people's faith in sure victory and optimism are based on their pride and self-respect for the socialist motherland of Juche with tremendous strength that no formidable enemy can dare to provoke.
					
					 No matter how many times the world may change and no matter what storm and stress it has to weather, socialism of Juche deeply enshrined by the Korean people is invincible.

articles.title: Inevitable is Victory of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Inevitable is Victory of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Neither military threat and blackmail nor sanctions and pressure of the U.S. imperialists will prove effective before the invincible revolutionary army, the single-minded unity of the army and people of the DPRK and its might based on the self-reliant defence industry capable of manufacturing ultra-modern weapons and military technical hardware by its own efforts, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article.
					 Invariable are the principled stand and will of the DPRK to courageously meet all the vicious challenges of the hostile forces and all hardships, attain the goal of completing the nuclear force of the state, put an end to the U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail and open up a wide avenue to building a powerful socialist nation, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 It would be foolish to think that the DPRK, a country which has possessed powerful nuclear deterrence through an arduous struggle, would step back from the path chosen by it in fear of the sanctions and pressure of the hostile forces.
					
					 The sanctions and pressure will be ineffective before the DPRK whose army and people advance under the uplifted banner of self-reliance, rallied close around the great Party.
					
					 The sanctions and pressure offensive of the Trump group against the DPRK is the most ferocious, barbarous and dangerous move for annihilating a nation, something unprecedented in history.
					
					 With neither sanctions and pressure nor military threat and blackmail can the U.S. imperialists undermine the position of the DPRK as a nuclear weapons state.
					
					 The DPRK is ready for any challenges of the hostile forces.
					
					 Certain is the victory of the DPRK in the confrontation with the U.S.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slashes U.S. for Faulting "Human Rights Issue" of Other Countries
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slashes U.S. for Faulting "Human Rights Issue" of Other Countries
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. crime against humanity committed in Afghanistan has been put under international criminal investigation, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary.
					 Recently the British newspaper Independent cited detailed data to convey the fact. According to it, a public prosecutor of the International Criminal Court declared that he would conduct investigation into persons responsible for the crimes against humanity committed by the U.S. in Afghanistan. Presenting the massacre of more than 10 000 civilians by the U.S. there from 2007 to 2011 as typical evidence, he brought the lawsuit against the U.S. with the organization, pressing for a legitimate investigation into the case.
					
					 The commentary says it is unusual that the prosecutor of the ICC brought a lawsuit against the U.S., adding the reason is because the U.S. crimes are so serious and can no longer be connived at.
					
					 The massacre of peaceable citizens by the U.S. forces in Afghanistan was something beyond imagination, notes the commentary, and goes on:
					
					 It is quite natural that the U.S. should be brought to the ICC and face legal punishment as it is the world's worst human rights abuser which committed the hideous crimes against humanity through the massacre of civilians in Afghanistan under the pretext of a "war on terrorism" in breach of international law.
					
					 What matters is that this human rights abuser country faulted other countries' "human rights issue" whenever an opportunity presented itself and published "human rights report" every year to take issue with human rights performance in various countries, while styling itself a "human rights judge".
					
					 Recently it has hyped up the non-existent "human rights issue" in the DPRK and malignantly slandered it.
					
					 It is the height of impudence and a mockery of genuine human rights for the human rights abuser U.S. to find fault with the DPRK in which genuine human rights are guaranteed.
					
					 The U.S. had better mind its own business, before getting so impudent as to vociferate about the "human rights" of others.

articles.title: To Get Rid of DPRK's Nukes Is Just Daydream: Minju Joson
articles.content:
To Get Rid of DPRK's Nukes Is Just Daydream: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The American Conservative, Washington Post and a former assistant to the U.S. president for national security termed the denuclearization of north Korea unrealistic. They asserted "to recognize north Korea as a nuclear weapons state is the only reasonable way to stabilize the situation and prevent a strategic mistake."
					 Minju Joson Tuesday comments this scathing criticism of the ill-advised "crazy strategy" of the Trump administration which scuttled the settlement of the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula by persisting in extreme hostility toward the DPRK.
					
					 In order to protect the supreme interests of the country and security of its people from the escalating moves of the U.S. to isolate and stifle the DPRK, the Workers' Party of Korea set it as a strategic line of the country to simultaneously develop the two fronts and has stepped up the economic construction and the building of the nuclear force, the paper says, and goes on:
					
					 The present U.S. administration should have worked hard to find a solution to the matter in a right direction after drawing a due lesson from the failed DPRK policies of its predecessors.
					
					 However, the Trump administration has stirred up its confrontation with the DPRK without any proper calculation, bluffing as if they could "denuclearize the Korean peninsula."
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that the Trump administration will fall into a more awkward position due to its persistent hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 As claimed by all, it is just as foolish as wanting to get a chicken from a boiled egg to expect the dismantlement of the DPRK's nukes at present.

articles.title: Thoughtless Pursuance of U.S. Will Bring Tragic End: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Thoughtless Pursuance of U.S. Will Bring Tragic End: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Japanese Prime Minister Abe's despicable act during Trump's visit to Japan has drawn the derision of the world people.
					 At a press conference after talks with Trump, Abe voiced his consistent support for Trump's stand that all options are on the table over the Korean issue, and even asserted that there was a strong reconfirmation that Japan and the U.S. are 100 percent identical in their stands to the Korean issue.
					
					 The faithful stooge's despicable act of supporting the master's hostile policy toward the DPRK truly arouses aversion.
					
					 It seems to be the invariable disposition peculiar to political dwarf Japan to blindly follow the U.S. and support whatever it does with all devotion. 
					
					 Abe flattered the master and actively fanned up his zeal for a nuclear war against the DPRK. Lurking behind this is his intention to fan up the vanity of old lunatic Trump and keep the situation tense and thus fish in troubled waters.
					
					 In fact, Japan wishes for the tension on the Korean peninsula more than others.
					
					 The Abe group which regards the escalation of tension on the peninsula as an excellent pretext for the constitutional revision and for pushing forward its plan for becoming a military giant is fully supporting the crazy strategy of Trump for increasing the danger of a nuclear war.
					
					 Abe who used to be lucky to tide over ruling crisis with the "threat to security" by the DPRK as a pretext, is now going in high spirits and openly fanning up his master's racket for a nuclear war.
					
					 With Trump's visit as an occasion, he loudly trumpeted about "serious threat to international community as a whole" and "maximum pressure". This was prompted by his sordid intention.
					
					 It is the invariable ambition of the island men to launch continental aggression with the backing of the U.S.
					
					 It is worth taking note of the statement of a former Japanese diplomat that "it is only Trump out of the leaders of various countries in the present world who talk about threat by force at the UN general Assembly and it is only Abe out of the leaders of various countries who pursues Trump. How despicable the talks between the two persons are".
					
					 Washington Post on Nov. 6 commented that Trump and Abe have taken the same stand out of their common hostility toward the DPRK but their relationship is the strategic master-slave one and the attitude of Trump treating Abe is the one of treating his assistant.
					
					 The "majestic and powerful diplomacy" touted by Abe is, in the long run, nothing but diplomacy submitting to the U.S.
					
					 Such diplomacy will not help "defend the lives and a peaceful life of Japanese" but will cause misfortune.
					
					 Japan should mind that it will face a miserable end should it go reckless relying on the U.S. which is no more than a paper tiger.

articles.title: Former S. Korean Defense Minister Detained
articles.content:
Former S. Korean Defense Minister Detained
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Traitor Kim Kwan Jin, former puppet defense minister of south Korea, was detained early on the morning of Nov. 11.
					 Kim had been investigated on Nov. 7 by the prosecution on charges of building up public opinion in favor of the conservative forces' coming to power by hiring graduates from Korea University as agents of cyber command ahead of 2012 presidential election.
					
					 During the investigation, Kim confessed that the cyber command's red herring was instructed by the then president Lee Myung Bak.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Stage Protest Actions
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Stage Protest Actions
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Confederation of Trade Unions of south Korea sponsored the 2017 Rally of Workers in Seoul on Nov. 12 demanding the authorities ensure the rights of workers and eradicate the evils of the south Korean society, according to the south Korean online newspaper Thongil News.
					 More than 50 000 workers gathered at the plaza of the Seoul City Office.
					
					Speakers at the rally urged the regime to combat evils, reform the society, withdraw THAAD, bring peace to the Korean peninsula and release the prisoners of conscience including the chairman of the Confederation.
					
					 The acting chairman of the Confederation blamed the regime for not eradicating the evils of society, contrary to the demand of the candlelight demonstrators for building a new society.
					
					 The chairman of the Teachers Union declared that the union would launch a general strike on Nov. 24, criticizing the regime for failing to retract the decision on outlawing the union and eradicate the evils in education.
					
					 The chairman of the Metal Workers Trade Union said not only the workers under the union but also all workers in the world would launch solidarity actions if the regime fails to grant an amnesty for the chairman of the Confederation.
					
					 At the end of the rally they picketed in various parts of the city.

articles.title: Internet Newspaper of Koreans in U.S. Criticizes S. Korean Chief Executive
articles.content:
Internet Newspaper of Koreans in U.S. Criticizes S. Korean Chief Executive
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A commentary criticizing the south Korean chief executive for his sycophancy to the U.S. was posted on Minjok Thongsin, an internet newspaper of Koreans in the U.S., on Nov. 10.
					 It blamed the Moon Jae In regime of south Korea for failing to get rid of the evils in various issues including sycophancy to the U.S., inequality in economy and human rights.
					
					 Censuring Moon's servile diplomacy toward Trump, the commentary urged Moon to think twice about his behavior as his predecessors met miserable ends while taking the lead in escalating confrontation with the compatriots in the north.

articles.title: National Meeting for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan
articles.content:
National Meeting for Supporting Korea's Reunification Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The 35th national meeting of the movement for supporting Korea's reunification was held in Kyoto of Japan on Nov. 4.
					 Attending it were Chairman Fumihiro Himori and members of the Japan Committee for the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, and members of the executive committee for the national meeting and representatives of the organizations for solidarity with the Korean people in different parts of Japan.
					
					 Present on invitation were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, and its other officials and Koreans in Japan.
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made and a message of greetings from the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries read out at the meeting.
					
					 Kenji Mizutani, general secretary of the Japan Committee for the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, made a keynote report.
					
					 The reporter noted that the situation of the Korean peninsula is getting worse day by day due to the U.S. and the Japanese authorities toeing the U.S. line.
					
					 Saying it is the U.S. that has posed a threat to the DPRK as it has ratcheted up the anti-DPRK sanctions and pressure, persistently refusing to sign a peace accord with the DPRK, he condemned the Japanese authorities for following the U.S.
					
					 Several personages made speeches calling for solidarity with the people of the DPRK in their efforts to achieve lasting peace on the peninsula and its reunification.
					
					 The meeting adopted an appeal which assails all sorts of military games against the DPRK and the UNSC "sanctions resolutions" against it and urges vigorous activities for the conclusion of a peace accord between the DPRK and the U.S. and the normalization of the DPRK-Japan diplomatic relations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Report Posted on Website by Regional Body
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Report Posted on Website by Regional Body
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The gist of the report made by respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un at the Second Plenary Meeting of the 7th Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea was posted on a website by the African Regional Committee for Friendship and Solidarity with the Korean People headquartered in Nigeria on November 8.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in DR Congo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A DR Congolese committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il was formed in Kinshasa on November 7.
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, was elected chairman of the remembrance committee.
					
					 The committee set the remembrance period from Nov. 7 to Dec. 17 and decided to hold political and cultural events such as a remembrance meeting, seminar on exploits, photo exhibition and film show in the period.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente irani
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam expresa condolencias al presidente irani
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Kim Yong Nam, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 13 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Republica Islamica de Iran, Hassan Rouhani, en relacion con que fueron causadas muchas perdidas humanas por un terremoto en la region de Kermanshah en el oeste del pais persico.
					En la misiva, el remitente expreso profundo pesar y consuelo al destinatario, victimas y sus familiares deseando que el presidente y el gobierno de Iran recuperen cuanto antes las consecuencias del desastre natural y estabilice la vida de los habitantes damnificados.

articles.title: Efectuada reunion ampliada de 4o pleno del 6o periodo del CC de USMC
articles.content:
Efectuada reunion ampliada de 4o pleno del 6o periodo del CC de USMC
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 14 en esta capital la reunion ampliada del 4o pleno del 6o periodo del Comite Central de la Union Socialista de Mujeres de Corea (USMC).
					En la ocasion tomaron parte las miembros y miembros suplentes del CC de la USMC y las funcionarias de la misma entidad.
					
					En la cita se discutieron las medidas para materializar las tareas presentadas por el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un en el 2o pleno del 7o periodo del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					La presidenta del CC de la USMC, Jang Chun Sil, presento el informe de la ocasion y otras intervinieron.
					
					Las oradoras subrayaron que en la reunion partidista, el Maximo Dirigente aclaro el rumbo de lucha y las tareas para registrar nuevo auge en la lucha por la construccion de una potencia socialista, haciendo gala del poderio de la unidad monolitica y levantando en alto la bandera de la independencia, la de autofortalecimiento.
					
					Exhortaron a todas las funcionarias e integrantes de la union a cumplir el deber de las mujeres coreanas en la ofensiva general de hoy para materializar las resoluciones del VII Congreso del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, teniendo la conviccion invencible y el espiritu de lucha por la materializacion decisiva.
					
					Subrayaron que todas las organizaciones de la USMC dinamizaran los trabajos politicos y las campanas masivas para producir nuevo auge en la construccion de la potencia economica socialista con el poderio del autofortalecimiento y de las ciencias y tecnicas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun rechaza la acusacion de EE.UU. en el tema de DDHH
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun rechaza la acusacion de EE.UU. en el tema de DDHH
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el periodico britanico Independent transmitio que EE.UU. se hizo el objeto de investigacion internacional por sus crimenes antieticos perpetrados en Afganistan. 
					Segun el rotativo, un fiscal de la Corte Penal Internacional declaro que iniciara la investigacion sobre las figuras norteamericanas responsables de dichos crimenes. 
					
					El presento como prueba tipica el dato sobre el asesinato de mas de diez mil civiles, cometido por EE.UU. desde 2007 hasta 2011, y demando oficialmente a la Corte abrir la investigacion legal.
					
					El diario Rodong Sinmun, en un comentario individual divulgado el dia 14, insiste en que ese pleito inusitado contra EE.UU. deja conocer que son muy graves e intolerables los casos delictivos de este imperio.
					
					Supera la imaginacion la masacre de habitantes pacificos cometida en Afganistan por las tropas norteamericanas bajo el cartel de "guerra antiterrorista" y en violacion del derecho internacional, reitera el comentario citando los hechos y continua:
					
					EE.UU., peor violador de DDHH, debe sentarse en el banquillo de acusados de la Corte Penal Internacional y someterse al castigo legal correspondiente.
					
					El problema es que ese pais no pierde ninguna oportunidad para criticar el "problema de DDHH" de otros paises y evalua a sus caprichos la situacion de ellos en esta materia publicando anualmente el "informe de DDHH" como si fuera el "juez".
					
					En estos dias, esta enfrascado en calumniar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea escandalizando de continuo el inexistente "problema de DDHH".
					
					Esta acusacion es el climax de cinismo y burla a los genuinos derechos humanos porque estos son garantizados perfectamente en la RPDC.
					
					EE.UU. debera corregir la situacion de DDHH de casa, en lugar de cuestionar a otros.

articles.title: ACNC comenta conducta mezquina de Abe
articles.content:
ACNC comenta conducta mezquina de Abe
Pyongyang, 14 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Es criticado por todo el mundo lo que hizo el premier japones Abe durante la visita de Trump a su pais.
					En la entrevista de prensa concedida despues del dialogo con el visitante, Abe disparateo que apoya constantemente la posicion del presidente norteamericano de que estan sobre la mesa todas las opciones frente al Norte de Corea. 
					
					Para colmo, chismeo que reafirma una vez mas que son iguales en cien por ciento la posicion de Japon y la de EE.UU. en el problema coreano.
					
					Resulta asquerosa la actitud de Abe que se porta como perro mimado en implementar la politica hostil anti-RPDC de su amo gringo.
					
					Esta vez, el alento la fiebre de guerra nuclear de Trump contra la RPDC para sacar provechos de la exacerbacion de la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Es que para la banda de Abe, el empeoramiento de la situacion es un buen pretexto para la enmienda de la Constitucion y la conversion de su pais en una potencia militar. 
					
					El premier japones ya ha logrado exito en eludir la crisis de gobernacion utilizando como carta el falso rumor de que el Norte de Corea "amenaza la seguridad".
					
					En ese contexto, con motivo de la visita de Trump, hablo tanto de la "grave amenaza para la sociedad internacional en su conjunto" y la "maxima presion".
					
					Retomar el camino de agresion al continente con el amparo de EE.UU. es la ambicion invariable de los reaccionarios japoneses.
					
					Llama la atencion el discurso de un ex diplomatico japones quien habia dicho que entre los jefes de Estado del mundo actual, Trump es el unico que se refiere a la amenaza con fuerzas armadas en la Asamblea General de la ONU y Abe tambien es el unico que le sigue. Seguidamente, se pregunto cuan repugnante seria el dialogo entre esas dos personas.
					
					Washington Post fechado 6 comento que las relaciones entre Trump y Abe son las serviles en sentido estrategico si bien ellos mismos se pusieron en la misma direccion compartiendo la hostilidad a la RPDC.
					
					En fin de cuentas, la "diplomacia gigantesca y poderosa" preconizada por Abe no es mas que la humillante y servil a EE.UU.
					
					Tal diplomacia servira de fuente de desgracias para la poblacion japonesa, lejos de "garantizarle la vida pacifica".
					
					Japon debe tener presente que le tocara el arruinamiento tragico si sigue actuando como marioneta del fanfarroneado imperio americano.
